abs: Given a function depending both on decision parameters and nuisance variables, we consider the issue of estimating and quantifying uncertainty on profile optima and/or optimal points as functions of the nuisance variables. The proposed methods base on interpolations of the objective function constructed from a finite set of evaluations. Here the functions of interest are reconstructed relying on a kriging model, but also using Gaussian field conditional simulations, that allow a quantification of uncertainties in the Bayesian framework. Besides, we elaborate a variant of the Expected Improvement criterion, that proves efficient for adaptively learning the set of profile optima and optimizers. The results are illustrated on a toy example and through a physics case study on the optimal packing of polydisperse frictionless spheres.
title: Bayesian Adaptive Reconstruction of Profile Optima and Optimizers
